meanings.sent1: The blacksmith sulfurizes the iron to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The scientist sulfurizes the compound to study its properties.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally sulfurizes the soup, giving it an unexpected tangy flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist sulfurizes the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a striking masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener sulfurizes the soil, making the plants grow healthier and greener.

meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction with sulfur.
meanings.sent1: The metal sulfurizes when exposed to the sulfuric fumes.
meanings.sent2: The organic matter sulfurizes as it decomposes in the presence of sulfur.
meanings.sent3: The potion sulfurizes in the cauldron, emitting a strange purple smoke.
meanings.sent4: The fabric sulfurizes under extreme heat, changing its color and texture.
meanings.sent5: The rock sulfurizes over time, forming unique mineral formations.
